p:
The natural product Aureothin, which is produced by Streptomyces thioluteus
12 , harbours a γ-pyrone group and a tetrahydrofuran ring separated from a 4-nitro phenyl group by a diene backbone (Table 1, #1). The nitro group in the aryl moiety bears high risk for toxicity
13 which is a liability for drug development. We decided to investigate structure-activity-relationships (SAR) of a broader scope of new, more drug-like Aureothin analogues.
